casebody.data:
QUALITY BUILT HOMES INCORPORATED, et al.
v.
TOWN OF CARTHAGE 315PA15-2 Supreme Court of North Carolina. August 22, 2017 James E. Scarbrough, Attorney at Law, James R. DeMay, Attorney at Law, Concord, John F. Scarborough, Attorney at Law, Madeline Trilling, Attorney at Law, for Quality Built Homes Incorporated, et al. Susan K. Burkhart, Attorney at Law, Raleigh, for Town of Carthage. Stephen D. Feldman, Attorney at Law, Paul M. Cox, Attorney at Law, Raleigh, Steven A. Scoggan, Attorney at Law, Greensboro, F. Paul Calamita, III, Attorney at Law, for N.C. Water Quality Association and Seven Municipalities. J. Daniel Bishop, Attorney at Law, Charlotte, Joseph W. Moss, Attorney at Law, Greensboro, for Union County.

The following order has been entered on the motion filed on the 17th of August 2017 by Union County for leave to file Amicus Curiae Brief:

"Motion Allowed by order of the Court in conference, this the 22nd of August 2017."

Unless already submitted, the Amicus Brief shall be submitted to the court within *164the times allowed and in the manner provided by Appellate Rule 28(i).
